noPermission.description_embed: You do not have permission to use this command!

disabledFeatures.description_embed: You have successfully disabled the **{0}** feature.

enabledFeatures.description_embed: You have successfully enabled the **{0}** feature.

initCommand.description_already_embed: This server has already been initialized. Further initialization is not possible. Use **/config** to modify its configuration.
initCommand.description_embed: You have successfully initialized Alka Hub. Now you can fully enjoy all the features of Alka Hub!

helpCommand.description_embed: Hello! Below you'll find the list of commands for Alka Hub: Make sure you've invited Alka with the necessary permissions (Administrator) to ensure the proper functioning of various features. Only use official links found in various Discord lists and official documentation.
helpCommand.footer: We recommend reading **our documentation** for any doubts, you can find it in our [Official Discord](https://discord.gg/X7KPcynxfB) -> alka-docs; for any issues, you can open a report -> Technical Support.
helpCommand.general_commands:
- **/help** *[NO HASH]* - This command displays the complete list of available commands.
- **/init** *[NO HASH]* - This command initializes server configurations and language to use from those available.
- **/features** *[features]* - This command enables or disables available features in Alka Hub.
helpCommand.logs_commands: - **/logschannel** *[logschannel]* - This command sets various logs channels to send events from the Logs System.
helpCommand.admin_commands:
- **/permission** *[NO HASH]* - This command sets permissions for roles for features and commands, these permissions are set via HASH.
- **/permissionlist** *[permissionlist]* - This command displays various permissions set based on the role.
helpCommand.ticket_commands:
- **/ticket** *[ticket]* - This command initiates configuration through a specifically created channel of the ticket system, follow the instructions.
- **/ticketcomponents** *[ticket]* - This command sets components (buttons) in the ticket message set via /ticket
helpCommand.autovoice_commands: - **/autovoice** *[autovoice]* - This command initiates configuration through a specifically created channel of the auto voice system, follow the instructions.
